intro: Tabebuia × rosariensis, commonly known as the pink trumpet tree, is a hybrid species native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a deciduous tree belonging to the Bignoniaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The flowers typically display a range of colors, from white to pink and orange, depending on the variety. The tree has a smooth, grey bark and produces long, flat, woody pods containing seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in landscaping due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
